title: Digits or capital letters are not accepted in the public chat topic name
body:
***Type*** Bug

***Summary***: When user tries to join public chat and types in the public chat topic **digits** OR **capital letters** - the value of what was tap appears and removed right away (so it looks like blinking). It's also noticeable that what was entered after digits/capital letters appended, - this may be connected to https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/2603 though. 
It's all fine for letter case chars format.
It's all fine when I type digits/capital letter for 'New group chat' name

**Expected behavior**
Topic of the public chat accept and keep on screen digits and capital letters when user type any of it

**Actual behavior**
Digits/capital letters removed right away after it was typed

### Reproduction

1) Open Status
2) Submit valid password to create a new user
3) Navigate to 'Chats' screen
4) Tap to '+' button to get to 'Start new chat' page.
5) Select 'Join public chat'
6) Type letter case char (for example I used "ty"). It's all fine on this stage.
7) Type digit values
8) Type capital letters value

**Status version**: 0.9.10-443-g460fa38+ nightly develop build (https://jenkins.status.im/job/status-react/job/nightly/108/) (links to .apk - http://artifacts.status.im:8081/artifactory/nightlies-local/im.status.ethereum-460f6a.apk)

**Operating System:**
Android 7.0 Samsung J7 2017 (real device)
Android 6.0 Samsung Galaxy S6 (Genymotion emulator)

Logs and video can be accessed by the link Logs and https://app.testfairy.com/projects/4803622-status/builds/7291119/sessions/31/?accessToken=z8O0k6BnP4nXmWEwIvmaPRuRCbM (00:00 - 01:45). **Note:** it's not visible on video that what was typed "blinks" (appended and removed) - but is see in logs, for instance:
